title: Acanthosis Nigricans: Clinical Overview and Classification
short_description: Clinical document describing acanthosis nigricans, a skin condition characterized by hyperpigmentation and velvety thickening of skin folds.
long_description: This clinical reference document provides a comprehensive overview of acanthosis nigricans (AN), a dermatological condition marked by abnormal hyperpigmentation and hyperkeratosis of the skin, particularly in fold regions such as the neck, groin, and axillae. The document outlines the various forms of AN, including benign variants that may be inherited as primary conditions, associated with underlying syndromes, obesity, or medication use, as well as malignant forms that occur in association with cancerous tumors. This resource serves as an educational tool for healthcare professionals to understand the classification and clinical presentation of this important dermatological marker.
